European.text: European weaves are inspired by weaves historically worn as armor originating in Europe. European weaves tend to have a noticible grain due ot the rings alternating direction each row. Below is a list of articles about weaves of the European family.

weave.caption: The Japanese 4-in-1 weave, a very basic weave.
weave.text: In chainmail a weave is an infinitely repeating pattern and unique of rings, where each ring meaningfully contributes such that removing one ring drastically changes its characteristics.

chain.text: In chainmail a chain is a weave that is infinitely repeatable in one direction.

sheet.text: In chainmail a sheet is a weave that is infinitely repeatable in two directions that are perpendicular to each other.

aspect_ratio.text: The Aspect Ratio(AR) of is how large a ring is(relative to its wire thickness) with a larger AR meaning a larger ring. It is calculated as Inner Diameter/Wire Diameter.

inner_diameter.text: The Inner Diameter(ID) of a ring is the diameter of the circle formed by the inside edge of a ring.

wire_diameter.text: The Wire Diameter(WD) of a ring is the distance from the inner edge of the ring to the closest point on the outer edge of the ring.

standard_wire_gauge.text: Standard Wire Gauge(sWG) is a wire guage system that assigns a number to a specified thickness (Wire Diameter) of wire with a thicker wire having a smaller gauge. You can read more about it here.

american_wire_gauge.text: American Wire Gauge(AWG) is a wire guage system that assigns a number to a specified thickness (Wire Diameter) of wire with a thicker wire having a smaller gauge. You can read more about it here.
